body_html:
Ok. Until our admin can install the new cuda version, I have replaced the libcudnn-file in the torch lib folder with the older version and then the code from above runs without error... Is this setup likely to cause some bugs later? :)

$ cp /usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.5.0.5 ~/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/lib/libcudnn.so.6
$ python3.5 pytorch_cudnn.py 
Files already downloaded and verified
Files already downloaded and verified
Cudnn version: 5005
[1,  2000] loss: 2.183
[1,  4000] loss: 1.824
[1,  6000] loss: 1.671
[1,  8000] loss: 1.574
[1, 10000] loss: 1.519
[1, 12000] loss: 1.444
[2,  2000] loss: 1.383
[2,  4000] loss: 1.322
[2,  6000] loss: 1.318
[2,  8000] loss: 1.309
[2, 10000] loss: 1.258
[2, 12000] loss: 1.264
Finished Training

body:
Ok. Until our admin can install the new cuda version, I have replaced the libcudnn-file in the torch lib folder with the older version and then the code from above runs without error... Is this setup likely to cause some bugs later? :) 

```
$ cp /usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.5.0.5 ~/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/lib/libcudnn.so.6
$ python3.5 pytorch_cudnn.py 
Files already downloaded and verified
Files already downloaded and verified
Cudnn version: 5005
[1,  2000] loss: 2.183
[1,  4000] loss: 1.824
[1,  6000] loss: 1.671
[1,  8000] loss: 1.574
[1, 10000] loss: 1.519
[1, 12000] loss: 1.444
[2,  2000] loss: 1.383
[2,  4000] loss: 1.322
[2,  6000] loss: 1.318
[2,  8000] loss: 1.309
[2, 10000] loss: 1.258
[2, 12000] loss: 1.264
Finished Training
```
